intro: Crudia bantamensis, commonly known as the Bantam cudweed, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia, particularly Indonesia. It belongs to the family Cichoriaceae, which includes dandelions and other similar species. The plant is characterized by its hairy, basal leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
